ygData.subject: Re: Direwolf Fur Cloak
ygData.msgSnippet: Heyas, The stones are really easy to spot. They show up on the white snow as bright (almost neon) red. They are No drop, so you can t give them away,
ygData.messageBody:
Heyas, <br><br>The stones are really easy to
spot. They show up on the white snow as bright (almost
neon) red. They are No drop, so you can't give them
away, but they are found lying on the ground to the
west & south of the Ry'Gorr fort. BTW I'm still using
the cloak at L39.<br><br>As for stats, AC is king.
Ry'Gorr seems to be the default favorite for pre Tolans,
but Ivy Etched is great for us too. Then you can
choose to work on STR, DEX or WIS. STR will help with
mele max damage & wieght issues, DEX will help with
archery, trade skills & hit accuracy in mele & Wis helps
with casting.<br><br>Here's a breakdown of my armor
today<br><br>Head: Kylong War Helm<br>Shouder: Crested
Spaulders<br>Bracers: Hero & Scavengin<br>Arms: Ivy Etched<br>Legs:
Ry'Gorr<br>Neck: Ry'Gorr<br>Face: Platinum Silvered Ruby
Veil<br>Feet: Dwarven Work Boots<br>Ears: Forest
Loops<br>Rings: Jagged Bands<br>Chest: Ivy Etched Tunic<br>Waist:
Thick Banded Belt (Strawspun until yesterday
Woot!)<br>Cloak: Dire Wolf Fur Cloak<br>Gloves Iskar
Scaled<br><br>Some other good items that I've worn in the past are:
Sarnak Emblazened Tabbard (chest), Golden Black Pearl
Choker, Cougar Claw & Orc Fang Earrings, Barbed Arm &
legplates, Sebilite Scale Boots, Thick Leather
Apron....blah, blah, blah<br><br>There should be tons of
different stuff out there that you can use and afford. I
personally have the most fun questing to see if I can
constantly improve my weapons and armor. That's just what
floats my boat.....<br><br>Have fun!<br>Tetzu<br>39
Ranger <br>Master of Wandering
Around<br><br><br>P.S.<br>CHA & INT are almost completely unused by Rangers in
combat use. CHA helps when buying stuff from vendors
(not that much though) and INT helps you learn things
like languages (we are WIS based casters so it's not
important)
